document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Foreign Languages

491BD520DFE80131F45B68A86D17958E.description: Intercultural Experiences: Students will travel to communities where the language studied is spoken and/or host someone from a country where the language studied is spoken

491B8C00DFE80131F45A68A86D17958E.description: Further learning: Students will look for opportunities to learn more about languages and cultures

491B2D30DFE80131F45968A86D17958E.description: Understanding: Students will deepen their understanding of other cultures through various avenues; such as cuisine, sports, theatre, dance, and art

491AD8E0DFE80131F45868A86D17958E.description: Careers: Students will investigate careers where skills in another language and/or cross-cultural understanding are needed

491A82A0DFE80131F45768A86D17958E.description: Media: Students will use various media in the language studied for study, work, or pleasure

491A34A0DFE80131F45668A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will show evidence of becoming life-long learners by using the language for personal enjoyment and enrichment.
comments: Students who study another language are better prepared to be responsible members of their communities because of their global perspective. They have expanded their employment opportunities both at home and abroad and have access to a wider variety of resources where they can pursue topics of personal interest.

4919A1E0DFE80131F45468A86D17958E.description: Communication: Students will exchange information with people locally and around the world through avenues such as penpals, e-mail, videos, speeches, and publications

49194BE0DFE80131F45368A86D17958E.description: Outreach: Students will participate in activities where the ability to communicate in a second language may be beneficial, including business internships, exchange programs, and sister city projects

49190340DFE80131F45268A86D17958E.description: Service: Students will provide service to their school and community through such activities as tutoring, teaching, translating, interpreting, and assisting speakers of other languages

4918BA80DFE80131F45168A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will use the language both within and beyond the school setting.
comments: As businesses expand domestic and international markets, and as people of the world meet each other more often through face-to-face encounters and/or the use of technology, the need for students to be proficient in other languages becomes critical in order for the United States to maintain international respect and economic competitiveness.

4917C740DFE80131F44E68A86D17958E.description: Characteristics of culture: Students will understand the concept of culture as they compare other cultures to their own

491760C0DFE80131F44D68A86D17958E.description: Comparisons: Students will compare the form, meaning, and importance of certain perspectives, products, and practices in different cultures

49171820DFE80131F44C68A86D17958E.description: Cultural variations: Students will discuss the meaning of perspectives, products, and practices in different cultures

4916CFC0DFE80131F44B68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate understanding of the concept of culture through comparisons of the cultures studied and their own.
comments: Students who study more than one language continuously compare and contrast the practices of people in different cultures. This helps students understand themselves better and builds understanding of different responses to similar situations.

49163830DFE80131F44968A86D17958E.description: Phonetics: Students will compare the sound-symbol association of English to that of the language studied

4915DDD0DFE80131F44868A86D17958E.description: Cultural characteristics: Students will identify cultural characteristics of language such as formalities, levels of politeness, informal and formal language

49157C60DFE80131F44768A86D17958E.description: Translation: Students will identify words and expressions that have no equivalent in another language

49152960DFE80131F44668A86D17958E.description: Idioms: Students will identify expressions that cannot be translated word for word in order to derive meaning

4914CC70DFE80131F44568A86D17958E.description: Structures: Students will identify cognates (words similar to English), word roots, prefixes, suffixes, and sentence structure to derive meaning

comments: Students who study more than one language gain insight into the nature of their own language and can analyze the power of word choice. They can compare how different language systems express meaning and reflect culture.
49148050DFE80131F44468A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the language studied and their own.

49138EC0DFE80131F44168A86D17958E.description: Accessing resources: Students will access information in the language studied in order to gain greater insight about other cultures and/or their own

49133FB0DFE80131F44068A86D17958E.description: Popular media: Students will read, view, listen to, and talk about subjects contained in popular media from other countries in order to gain a perspective on other cultures

4912E690DFE80131F43F68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will acquire information and recognize the distinctive viewpoints that are available only through a language and its cultures.
comments: Being able to access information in more than one language gives students a much richer base of knowledge. Not only is there a greater choice of resources, but there is also the opportunity to analyze a topic from another culture's perspective, providing students with unique insights.

491239B0DFE80131F43D68A86D17958E.description: Accessing resources: Students will access resources in the language studied on topics being discussed or researched in other classes

4911ECB0DFE80131F43C68A86D17958E.description: Reading and listening: Students will read material, listen to and/or watch programs in the language studies on topics from other classes

49119BF0DFE80131F43B68A86D17958E.description: Speaking and writing: Students will use topics and skills from other school subjects to discuss and/or write in the language studied

491151D0DFE80131F43A68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will reinforce and further their knowledge of other disciplines through a language other than English.
comments: The conscious effort to connect the study of languages with other disciplines opens doors to information and experiences that enrich students' entire lives. Students can use information and skills learned in other classes to practice their new language. Conversely, language classes provide additional information to enhance what students learn in other disciplines.

491078C0DFE80131F43768A86D17958E.description: Geography: Students will evaluate the target country's geography with respect to the impact on politics, economics, and history

49102AD0DFE80131F43668A86D17958E.description: Mutual influences: Students will explain the impact of a culture's views on what is happening and could happen in the world today

490FCF90DFE80131F43568A86D17958E.description: Contributions: Students will examine the role and significance of other cultures on the target culture

490F80C0DFE80131F43468A86D17958E.description: Objects and symbols: Students will connect objects and symbols of other cultures to the underlying beliefs and perspectives

490EED00DFE80131F43268A86D17958E.description: Geography: Students will explain the impact of the target country's geography on the people's beliefs, perspectives, and attitudes

490EA460DFE80131F43168A86D17958E.description: Mutual influences: Students will discuss how historical and contemporary influences from other cultures shape people's views of the world and their own attitudes toward issues facing the world

490E52E0DFE80131F43068A86D17958E.description: Contributions: Students will examine the role and significance of the contributions of other cultures in today's world

490DFD50DFE80131F42F68A86D17958E.description: Objects and symbols: Students will research the historic background of objects and symbols and how they came to represent certain cultures

490D6CF0DFE80131F42D68A86D17958E.description: Geography: Students will explain the impact of the target country's geography on daily life

490D2370DFE80131F42C68A86D17958E.description: Mutual influences: Students will identify some historical and contemporary influences from other cultures that impact today's society such as the democratic form of government and environmental concerns

490CD7B0DFE80131F42B68A86D17958E.description: Contributions: Students will identify major contributions and historical figures from the culture studied that are significant in the target cultures

490C8080DFE80131F42A68A86D17958E.description: Objects and symbols: Students will compare objects and symbols, such as flags or currency, from other cultures to those found in their own culture

490BDAE0DFE80131F42868A86D17958E.description: Geography: Students will identify countries, regions, and geographic features where the target language is spoken

490B8A60DFE80131F42768A86D17958E.description: Mutual influences: Students will identify some historical and contemporary influences from other cultures that are significant in their own culture such as explorers and settlers, music, and sports

490B33B0DFE80131F42668A86D17958E.description: Contributions: Students will identify some major contributions and historical figures from the cultures studied that are significant in the target culture

490AD960DFE80131F42568A86D17958E.description: Objects and symbols: Students will identify objects and symbols, such as flags or currency, that are used day-to-day and represent other cultures

490A2960DFE80131F42368A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between the products and perspectives of the cultures studied.
comments: To respect and appreciate the diversity of their world, students need to learn about the contribution of other cultures to the world and the solutions they offer to problems confronting them. Awareness of these contributions helps students understand how their views and other people's views of the world have been influenced.

49096DD0DFE80131F42168A86D17958E.description: Historical influences: Students can discuss historical and philosophical backgrounds that have influenced a culture's patterns of interaction

490920B0DFE80131F42068A86D17958E.description: Beliefs and attitudes: Students will explain how beliefs, perspectives, and attitudes affect the target countries' position on global issues

4908C900DFE80131F41F68A86D17958E.description: Cultural activities: Students will examine the role and importance of various social activities within the cultures studied (such as religious celebrations, historical events, rites of passage)

49088280DFE80131F41E68A86D17958E.description: Patterns of interaction: Students will interact in a variety of cultural contexts (formal/informal, social/work) with sensitivity and respect

4907F400DFE80131F41C68A86D17958E.description: Historical influences: Students will exhibit broader and deeper knowledge of historical and philosophical backgrounds that explain patterns of interaction

4907A1A0DFE80131F41B68A86D17958E.description: Beliefs and attitudes: Students will discuss and compare beliefs and attitudes within the cultures studied and their own in relation to home, school, community and nation

49074C20DFE80131F41A68A86D17958E.description: Cultural activities: Students will compare and contrast activities from other cultures to their own in relation to home, school, community, and nation

4906C4C0DFE80131F41968A86D17958E.description: Patterns of interaction: Students will interact with respect according to the social and cultural requirements of most social and some formal contexts

49061F40DFE80131F41768A86D17958E.description: Historical influences: Students will begin to be able to explain historical and philosophical reasons for different patterns of interaction

4905C890DFE80131F41668A86D17958E.description: Beliefs and attitudes: Students will identify some common beliefs and attitudes within the cultures studied and compare them to their own beliefs and attitudes

49057240DFE80131F41568A86D17958E.description: Cultural activities: Students will experience cultural and social activities common to students of similar age in the target cultures (such as holiday celebrations, school life, and pastimes)

49052290DFE80131F41468A86D17958E.description: Patterns of interaction: Students will interact with respect using culturally appropriate patterns of behavior in everyday informal and social situations

49048190DFE80131F41268A86D17958E.description: Historical influences: Students will identify reasons for different patterns of interaction

490418F0DFE80131F41168A86D17958E.description: Beliefs and attitudes: Students will identify some common beliefs and attitudes within the cultures studied such as social etiquette or the role of the family

4903B940DFE80131F41068A86D17958E.description: Cultural activities: Students will participate in and learn about age-appropriate cultural activities (such as games, songs, and holiday celebrations)

49036D90DFE80131F40F68A86D17958E.description: Patterns of interaction: Students will observe and imitate appropriate patterns of behavior (such as greetings or gestures) used with friends and family in the cultures studied

4902CF30DFE80131F40D68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between the practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.
comments: To fully understand another culture, students need to develop an awareness of another people's way of life, of the patterns of behavior that order their world, and of the traditional ideas, attitudes, and perspectives that guide their behaviors.

4901F410DFE80131F40A68A86D17958E.description: Forms of writing: Students will write formal compositions, research papers, and letters for a variety of purposes

490199F0DFE80131F40968A86D17958E.description: Recounting events: Students will recount a long story with a wide variety of details and descriptions

49013F70DFE80131F40868A86D17958E.description: Directions: Students will give a series of detailed instructions to someone with suggestions in how best to complete the task

4900E6A0DFE80131F40768A86D17958E.description: Speeches: Students will write and present a speech on a topic that has been researched

49008E70DFE80131F40668A86D17958E.description: Oral presentations: Students will present student-created works and authentic literature

48FFEC90DFE80131F40468A86D17958E.description: Forms of writing: Students will write formal compositions and letters for a variety of purposes

48FF98E0DFE80131F40368A86D17958E.description: Recounting events: Students will recount a story with substantive description and detail

48FF4AA0DFE80131F40268A86D17958E.description: Directions: Students will give a series of directions to someone, coaching the person in order to complete the task

48FEFEC0DFE80131F40168A86D17958E.description: Speeches: Students will write and deliver a short speech on a topic of personal interest

48FEA490DFE80131F40068A86D17958E.description: Oral presentations: Students will present student-created works and excerpts of authentic literature

48FDD430DFE80131F3FE68A86D17958E.description: Forms of writing: Students will write short compositions and letters

48FD8EB0DFE80131F3FD68A86D17958E.description: Recounting events: Students will tell a story incorporating some description and detail

48FD4850DFE80131F3FC68A86D17958E.description: Directions: Students will give simple directions to someone in order to complete a multi-step task

48FD0070DFE80131F3FB68A86D17958E.description: Speeches: Students will write and deliver a short presentation about their school or community

48FCB4E0DFE80131F3FA68A86D17958E.description: Oral presentations: Students will present student-created and/or authentic short plays, stories, skits, poems, and songs

48FC14F0DFE80131F3F868A86D17958E.description: Forms of writing: Students will write personal journals and/or brief messages to friends (postcard, letter, or e-mail)

48FBCB40DFE80131F3F768A86D17958E.description: Recounting events: Students will tell a simple story

48FB7F00DFE80131F3F668A86D17958E.description: Directions: Students will give simple commands and make requests of another person or group

48FB3440DFE80131F3F568A86D17958E.description: Speeches: Students will write and present a short narrative about themselves

48FAEA50DFE80131F3F468A86D17958E.description: Oral presentations: Students will dramatize student-created and/or authentic songs, short poems, skits, or dialogues

48FA48B0DFE80131F3F268A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will present information, concepts, and ideas to an audience of listeners or readers on a variety of topics in a language other than their own.
comments: Students must develop strong speaking and writing skills to communicate their thoughts, concepts, and opinions effectively to members of other cultures. This standard focuses on presenting information in a way that is appropriate for the audience.

48F9B510DFE80131F3F068A86D17958E.description: Strategies: In addition, students will analyze the author's use of language to understand a written text

48F96290DFE80131F3EF68A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will comprehend the main idea and supporting ideas, and make inferences in a wide variety of authentic written materials

48F90A30DFE80131F3EE68A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will understand written materials on a wide variety of topics and in a wide variety of formats

48F89850DFE80131F3ED68A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will comprehend the main idea and supporting ideas of oral presentations and authentic spoken materials

48F82470DFE80131F3EC68A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will understand spoken language on a wide variety of topics

48F76690DFE80131F3EA68A86D17958E.description: Strategies: In addition, students will use the dictionary to look up words that cannot be deciphered via previously learned strategies

48F71690DFE80131F3E968A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will comprehend the main idea and key supporting ideas, and begin to make inferences in selected authentic written materials

48F6BE70DFE80131F3E868A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will understand more complex written materials on a variety of topics and formats

48F67690DFE80131F3E768A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will comprehend the main ideas and supporting ideas of oral presentations and selected authentic materials including videos, and radio and television broadcasts

48F62CF0DFE80131F3E668A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will understand spoken language that incorporates more advanced vocabulary and structures

48F59600DFE80131F3E468A86D17958E.description: Strategies: In addition, students will begin to derive meaning through use of prediction, prefixes, suffixes, root words, words similar to English, contextual clues, and word order

48F545D0DFE80131F3E368A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will comprehend the main idea and some supporting ideas of selected authentic written materials

48F4F360DFE80131F3E268A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will understand selected written materials on topics of personal interest

48F4A530DFE80131F3E168A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will comprehend the main idea and some supporting ideas of selected authentic materials including recordings, broadcasts, and videos

48F44AA0DFE80131F3E068A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will understand spoken language that incorporates familiar vocabulary and structures

48F38840DFE80131F3DE68A86D17958E.description: Strategies: Students will use previous classroom experience with the language to understand its spoken and written forms

48F33310DFE80131F3DD68A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will comprehend the main idea of selected, short authentic written materials

48F2E2D0DFE80131F3DC68A86D17958E.description: Reading: Students will understand written materials on familiar topics that have strong visual support

48F270B0DFE80131F3DB68A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will comprehend simple daily conversations on familiar topics and selected, age-appropriate authentic recordings, broadcasts, and videos

48F21070DFE80131F3DA68A86D17958E.description: Listening: Students will understand spoken language on familiar topics that has strong visual support

comments: Students must develop strong listening and reading skills to interpret the concepts, ideas, and opinions expressed by members of other cultures through their media and their literatures. This standard focuses on increasing the level of understanding as students listen to, read, or view materials in a new language.
48F16BE0DFE80131F3D868A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand and interpret a language other than their own in its written and spoken form on a variety of topics.

48F0DEF0DFE80131F3D668A86D17958E.description: Comprehension: Students will ask for clarification and be able to paraphrase to ensure understanding

48F096E0DFE80131F3D568A86D17958E.description: Problem-solving: Students will discuss options and negotiate to solve a problem

48F04BF0DFE80131F3D468A86D17958E.description: Opinions: Students will defend personal preferences, feelings, and opinions with substantive arguments

48EFF860DFE80131F3D368A86D17958E.description: Questions: Students will ask and answer a variety of questions that require elaboration and substantiation of opinions

48EF9D20DFE80131F3D268A86D17958E.description: Conversations: Students will discuss or debate a wide variety of topics from the local to the international level, hypothesizing, convincing, persuading, and negotiating to reach a conclusion

48EEF100DFE80131F3D068A86D17958E.description: Comprehension: Students will ask for clarification and suggest alternative words to ensure understanding

48EE9680DFE80131F3CF68A86D17958E.description: Problem-solving: Students will suggest options for solving problems related to personal needs and needs of others

48EE4330DFE80131F3CE68A86D17958E.description: Opinions: Students will defend personal preferences, feelings, and opinions with more complete explanation

48EDED70DFE80131F3CD68A86D17958E.description: Questions: Students will ask and answer a variety of questions that require followup questions and responses for more information

48EDA4D0DFE80131F3CC68A86D17958E.description: Conversations: Students will discuss and defend an option on selected topics from the local to the international level

48ED09B0DFE80131F3CA68A86D17958E.description: Comprehension: Students will ask for simplification and clarification.

48ECBBB0DFE80131F3C968A86D17958E.description: Problem-solving: Students will give possible solutions to a problem related to a personal need

48EC6E30DFE80131F3C868A86D17958E.description: Opinions: Students will state personal preferences and feelings with some explanation

48EC1D20DFE80131F3C768A86D17958E.description: Questions: Students will ask and answer a variety of questions, giving reasons for their answers

48EBD0C0DFE80131F3C668A86D17958E.description: Conversations: Students will sustain a conversation including descriptions on selected topics about themselves and their state or country

48EB42F0DFE80131F3C468A86D17958E.description: Comprehension: Students will ask for repetition and repeat to ensure understanding

48EAFC30DFE80131F3C368A86D17958E.description: Problem-solving: Students will express personal needs

48EAB000DFE80131F3C268A86D17958E.description: Opinions: Students will state personal preferences and feelings

48EA5920DFE80131F3C168A86D17958E.description: Questions: Students will ask and answer questions, including biographical information

48EA1340DFE80131F3C068A86D17958E.description: Conversations: Students will carry on a short conversation about personal interests, including what they have done, are doing, and are planning to do

48E982F0DFE80131F3BE68A86D17958E.description: Students in Wisconsin will engage in conversations, provide and obtain information, express feelings and emotions, and exchange opinions in a language other than their own.
comments: Students must know how to use the language effectively in order to exchange ideas and information with other people in a culturally appropriate manner. This standard focuses on the goal of learning to engage in conversations.
